page.title: 07WALLINGTON AS I SEE IT TODAY
page.content: An old age pensioner living in the area gave us her views on the changes as follows: There has been a big change in shopping. Prices have increased great- ly and huge shopping centres and stores replace the small shops which used to sell only meat, bread, fish, etc. Many more people live here and to accommod- ate them highrise flats were built as well as houses. Many are built of steel and concrete instead of bricks, and also the windows are much bigger. Plastic is often used instead of wood. Fifty years ago public transport was tram or the rather dirty steam train. Today we have the bus or much cleaner electric train which are also much faster. There are many more cars on the roads and fewer bicycles, and the road surfaces are much improved from the cobbled streets of the past.
